data.title: Collection of eight original contact sheets from eight Lotte Reiniger films
data.meta_description: N.p. N.p., Circa 1950s. Collection of eight vintage photographic prints, produced in the 1950s, each with six illustrations from eight different films directed by noted German animator Lotte Reiniger. The films represented include Sleeping Beauty 1922 , Cinderella 1922 , The Magic Horse 1953 , Thumbelina 1954 , The Three Wishes 1954 , Caliph Stork 1954 , The Gallant Little Tailor 1954 , The Frog Prince 1954 , and Hansel and Gretel 1955 .
data.text:
Lotte Reiniger (director, animator)

N.p. N.p., Circa 1950s. Collection of eight vintage photographic prints, produced in the 1950s, each with six illustrations from eight different films directed by noted German animator Lotte Reiniger. The films represented include "Sleeping Beauty" (1922), "Cinderella" (1922), "The Magic Horse" (1953), "Thumbelina" (1954), "The Three Wishes" (1954), "Caliph Stork" (1954), "The Gallant Little Tailor" (1954), "The Frog Prince" (1954), and "Hansel and Gretel" (1955).

Reiniger was a pioneer of scherenschnitte, the German art of silhouette, heavily inspired by the ancient Chinese art of paper cutting and silhouette puppetry. She worked on over 40 films throughout her career, the most notable, "The Adventures of Prince Achmed" (1926), being the oldest surviving feature-length animated film.

Eight photographic prints, each 6.5 x 8.5 inches (16.5 x 21.5 cm). All Near Fine, two with numeric annotations in manuscript ink on the recto and one with a diagonal dampstain affecting the left edge.

[Book #160657]
